pullRequest.body:
We define `Subfield.relrank A B` and `IntermediateField.relrank A B`, which is `[B : A âŠ“ B]`, in particular, when `A â‰¤ B` it is `[B : A]`, the degree of the field extension `B / A`. This is similar to `Subgroup.relindex`.

---

<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>

Is it certain that we want this to be cardinal-valued rather than nat-valued? Personally, I feel like the convenience of nat-valued would outweigh the benefit of distinguishing countable vs uncountable degree extensions (my impression is that for infinite degree extensions, you usually care more about transcendence degree than the usual degree as a cardinal).

> Is it certain that we want this to be cardinal-valued rather than nat-valued? Personally, I feel like the convenience of nat-valued would outweigh the benefit of distinguishing countable vs uncountable degree extensions (my impression is that for infinite degree extensions, you usually care more about transcendence degree than the usual degree as a cardinal).

Personally I'd like to make `relrank` `Cardinal`-valued, following the naming of `rank` and `finrank`. We can also define `relfinrank` or `finrelrank` which is `Nat`-valued.

I think I agree with @tb65536 that Nat-valued is much more useful. I also agree with @acmepjz that this creates a bit of an inconsistency naming-wise. But maybe we should fix that be renaming `rank` to `cardinal_rank` (`crank` :rofl:) or something like that, so that `finrank` can be moved to `rank`.
Since `relrank` for subgroups is already Nat-valued, I think it doesn't hurt to do the same here.

This PR/issue depends on:
* ~~leanprover-community/mathlib4#15148~~
* ~~leanprover-community/mathlib4#15193~~
* ~~leanprover-community/mathlib4#15238~~
By **[Dependent Issues](https://github.com/z0al/dependent-issues)** (ðŸ¤–). Happy coding!
<!-- By Dependent Issues (Action) - DO NOT REMOVE -->
Just a few minor questions
This can use `relfinrank_eq_one_of_le`
Thanks!

Should these be `relRank` and `relFinrank`? I think the group theory one should be `relIndex` too. And then the file name would be RelRank ...
Hmm but then should `finrank` be `finRank` instead? ...
I have no preferences on this. Maybe you can open a poll on zulip...
Let's not worry about this here.
Very reminiscent of [Set.image_preimage_inter](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/Data/Set/Image.html#Set.image_preimage_inter); not sure if it's useful though.
Good observation!
Interesting that you use `relrank_comap` to prove this; would it be easier the other way around?

I didn't think of it. Actually initially the APIs are copied from that of `Subgroup.relindex` which only has `comap` one. The `map` one is added later, as in the field case, all maps are injective, so there are some more results.

It doesn't seem that you're following the `relindex` API exactly? For `relindex` this is proven using `index_comap_of_surjective`, which I can't find in this PR. Anyway, the following is a shorter proof by proving `lift_relrank_map_map` first:
```
theorem lift_relrank_map_map (f : E â†’+* L) :
    lift.{v} (relrank (A.map f) (B.map f)) = lift.{w} (relrank A B) :=
  -- typeclass inference is slow
  .symm <| Algebra.lift_rank_eq_of_equiv_equiv (((A âŠ“ B).equivMapOfInjective f f.injective).trans
    <| .subringCongr <| by rw [â† map_inf]; rfl) (B.equivMapOfInjective f f.injective) rfl

theorem relrank_map_map {L : Type v} [Field L] (f : E â†’+* L) :
    relrank (A.map f) (B.map f) = relrank A B := by
  simpa only [lift_id] using lift_relrank_map_map A B f

theorem lift_relrank_comap (f : L â†’+* E) (B : Subfield L) :
    lift.{v} (relrank (A.comap f) B) = lift.{w} (relrank A (B.map f)) :=
  (lift_relrank_map_map _ _ f).symm.trans <| congr_arg lift <| relrank_eq_of_inf_eq <| by
    rw [map_comap_eq, f.fieldRange_eq_map, inf_assoc, â† map_inf, top_inf_eq]
```

Thanks for the alternative proof! I'll check them.

> It doesn't seem that you're following the `relindex` API exactly?

That probably because some of the proof for `relindex` does not work in this case. So I changed the order of them.

pullRequest.title: feat(FieldTheory/Relrank): Relative rank of subfields and intermediate fields
